Articles.Content:
Bad news! Jeb's girlfriend Jessica cheated on him Now Jeb wants to get off Kerbin - FAST! Your job is to help him.

Jeb doesn't care where he goes. He just wants to escape Kerbin's gravity one last time.

Objective

Build a 1 man rocket and escape Kerbin as quickly as possible.

Scoring

Fastest time to achieving Kerbin escape trajectory. Lower is better.

One does not need to wait for escaping Kerbin's influence, just achieve a trajectory which will eventually bring Jeb away from Jessica.

Rules

  • Ship must be manned by Jeb only
  • No mods - Stock parts only
  • No infini-glide
  • No spamming de-couplers
  • No dumping/burning fuel on the launch pad. Jeb thinks it's a waste of time.

Successful posts must include

  • Screenshot on launchpad / airstrip
  • Screenshot from orbit map showing Kerbin escape trajectory (blue line with small arrow at end) and time from launch

Suggestions and considerations

When you are about to achieve Kerbin escape trajectory, switch to orbit map, zoom out and spam your screenshot key (F1). Consider what time of day is best for escaping Kerbin influence. Consider what launch trajectory is most effective.

Leaderboard

1) 44 seconds - 1500lego

2) 60 seconds - Hejnfelt

This is basically the "go-up-as-fast-as-possible" challenge whose name has slipped my mind. Nevertheless I'm trying with my scrub demo skills.

Infinite fuel gives you a lower bound for how fast you'll get up with rockets. Seems it'll be hard to make it in much better than 32 seconds. You could likely do a bit better using aerospikes, given how much drag you face, but not much.

I tried an aerospike-powered ship with a huge number of tiny stages, but I would need MechJeb to stage fast enough; I kept being behind and wasting fuel, so my best was over a minute on that spacecraft.
